high_risk.description: A patient with multiple concerning symptoms suggesting inflammatory arthritis
high_risk.medical_history: Family history of rheumatoid arthritis (mother diagnosed at age 50). No current medications. Non-smoker. Symptoms started 3 months ago and have been progressively worsening. Pain particularly affects hands, wrists, and knees bilaterally.

low_risk.description: A patient with minimal symptoms suggesting mechanical or exercise-related pain
low_risk.medical_history: Occasional right knee pain after running or extended standing. Pain improves with rest. Started jogging 6 weeks ago. No family history of arthritis or autoimmune conditions. Takes ibuprofen occasionally with good relief.

moderate_risk.description: A patient with some concerning features requiring further evaluation
moderate_risk.medical_history: Gradual onset shoulder and hip stiffness over past 2 months. History of hypothyroidism, well-controlled on levothyroxine. Mother had osteoarthritis. Difficulty raising arms above head in the morning.
